intro: Platycaulos mahonii, commonly known as the Mahon's flatstem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, flat, stem-like leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
